body_html:
Hi,
to me this looks like cudnn isn't installed on your machine or is located at a different path than /usr/local/cuda/lib64/. If it's installed in the cuda directory, ls -l /path/to/cuda/lib/libcud* should usually also include some output like /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn.so.5 -> libcudnn.so.5.1.5.
So you either need to find the path where cudnn lives or you could try the solution below.

To install cuda and cudnn you don't need root permissions on your machine, as long as your drivers are recent enough to support a specific cuda version:

Local installation of cuda and cudnn

Download Cuda (download the .run file) and Cudnn (needs an account).

  • Execute the cuda run file and install cuda to a local path, for example $HOME/lib/cuda-7.5/
    • Don't create a symlink to /usr/local/cuda.
    • Don't install the nvidia-driver, ignore the incomplete installation warning at the end of the cuda installation.
  • Extract the cudnn folder and copy the files in the cudnn-subfolder to the same cuda-8.0 subfolders.

Now you can specify $HOME/lib/cuda-7.5/ or whatever your directory is when running the tensorflow configure script.

body:
Hi,
to me this looks like cudnn isn't installed on your machine or is located at a different path than ` /usr/local/cuda/lib64/`. If it's installed in the cuda directory, `ls -l /path/to/cuda/lib/libcud*` should usually also include some output like `/usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn.so.5 -> libcudnn.so.5.1.5`.
So you either need to find the path where cudnn lives or you could try the solution below.

To install cuda and cudnn you don't need root permissions on your machine, as long as your drivers are recent enough to support a specific cuda version:

### Local installation of cuda and cudnn
Download [Cuda](https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-downloads) (download the .run file) and [Cudnn](https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn) (needs an account). 

- Execute the cuda run file and install cuda to a local path, for example $HOME/lib/cuda-7.5/
    - Don't create a symlink to /usr/local/cuda.
    - Don't install the nvidia-driver, ignore the incomplete installation warning at the end of the cuda installation.
- Extract the cudnn folder and copy the files in the cudnn-subfolder to the same cuda-8.0 subfolders.

Now you can specify ` $HOME/lib/cuda-7.5/` or whatever your directory is when running the tensorflow configure script.
